meanings.definition: The act of attempting to influence a jury corruptly.
meanings.sent1: The embracery of the jury member was evident in the way he tried to bribe others.
meanings.sent2: The judge was quick to recognize the embracery and took immediate action.
meanings.sent3: The embracery attempt was so blatant that even the court jester couldn't help but laugh.
meanings.sent4: The embracery was like a dark cloud hanging over the courtroom, casting doubt on the entire trial.
meanings.sent5: The news of the embracery scandal spread like wildfire, shocking the entire legal community.

meanings.definition: The offense of attempting to influence a jury corruptly.
meanings.sent1: The defendant was charged with embracery after his attempt to sway the jury was uncovered.
meanings.sent2: Embracery is a serious crime that undermines the integrity of the justice system.
meanings.sent3: The embracery charge left the defendant speechless, realizing the gravity of his actions.
meanings.sent4: The shadow of embracery loomed large over the courtroom, tainting the entire trial.
meanings.sent5: The prosecutor's case against the defendant was built on solid evidence of embracery.
